name: Horror (Named Icons, Dark & Gory Humor)

blackCards.text: Ghostface asked: 'What's your favourite ____?'
Michael Myers has one hobby: ____.
Jason Voorhees is surprisingly good at ____.
Freddy Krueger turned my dream into ____.
Chucky's parenting advice is basically ____.
Pennywise offered me ____ in the sewer.
Leatherface's dinner plan includes ____.
Pinhead promised 'such sights' and delivered ____.
The Blair Witch left behind ____.
The Xenomorph's love language is ____.
The Predator only hunts people with ____.
The Thing was caught impersonating ____.
Regan from The Exorcist shouted ____ across the room.
Jigsaw's new trap tests your ability to handle ____.
Annabelle won't stop staring at ____.
The Nun appeared and immediately did ____.
The Shining's hotel offered a complimentary ____.
Hannibal Lecter paired ____ with a nice chianti.
Norman Bates' motel special tonight is ____.
Candyman showed up when I said ____ five times.
Sam from Trick 'r Treat demands ____.
The Babadook's bedtime story is titled ____.
The Ring tape ends with ____.
The safest place in a horror movie is ____ (psych!)
The final jump-scare was actually ____.

whiteCards: a phone call that breathes instead of talks
a knife that looks freshly polished
footsteps in an empty hallway
a mask with fingerprints on the inside
a mirror that shows you arriving late
a closet that quietly inhales
a basement door that is warm to the touch
a chainsaw revving like it's laughing
a dream that tastes like burnt metal
a child's laugh in a locked room
a doll with a smug little grin
a sewer balloon that smells like rot
a meat hook with excellent posture
a puzzle box that wants attention
a bundle of sticks arranged like a warning
acid blood and a very bad day
a thermal-vision silhouette behind you
someone smiling with the wrong teeth
pea soup physics
a tricycle echoing down a corridor
a typewriter that types 'NO' by itself
a polite cannibal with terrible manners
a motel shower curtain that moves on its own
a mirror chant gone horribly right
a pumpkin-faced child judging your soul
a top hat that appears in the corner of your eye
a VHS tape that feels damp
a well that should not have a ladder
a 'safe room' full of knives
a flashlight that only works when it wants
a blood trail that writes your name
a doorway that wasn't there yesterday
a whisper using your full name
a door chain that unlocks itself
a photo developing into a warning
a floorboard that screams when stepped on
a shadow moving the wrong way
a howl that sounds like your mate's voice
a jump-scare delivered with perfect timing
a final girl with zero patience
